Event: DANG! I just ran over a bunny on the way home.  Why do I feel so bad? And Why do I have more compassion for animals than I do humans?
Post: "I just ran over a bunny on the way home and I can't shake off the guilty feeling. It's like I'm inherently cruel to animals, even though I know I shouldn't be. Maybe it's because deep down, I know that animals are helpless and can't defend themselves, unlike humans who can. Or maybe it's because society has conditioned me to view animals as innocent and pure, while humans are capable of both good and evil. Either way, it's a constant struggle to reconcile my actions with my values."
